I cannot play trumpet but here are some tips for you to get a clear, bright sound out of your trumpet while still playing at a high volume:

1. focus on your breath support - good breath support is crucial for producing a clear, full sound on the trumpet. ensure you have enough air in your lungs and use your diaphragm to push the air out.

2. use proper embouchure - ensure you are using the correct mouth position when playing. make sure the lips are firm enough to produce the sound but not so tight to restrict airflow.

3. warm-up properly - before beginning to play, do some warm-up exercises to get the muscles in your lips and entire body ready for playing.

4. play with good posture - sit or stand with good posture, keeping your shoulders relaxed, and your back straight. this ensures that your air flow is unobstructed.

5. use the appropriate mouthpiece - different mouthpieces create different sounds, try experimenting with different sizes and shapes to find one that works best for you.

6. practice regularly - practice regularly to build strength and endurance in your lips and develop good tone and technique.

7. listen to yourself - record yourself playing and listen back to identify areas where you can improve your tone and adjust your technique accordingly.

overall, getting a clear, bright sound at a high volume takes practice, patience, and careful attention to technique.
